title: How to Make Brandy Balls

steps.headline: Place all ingredients up to and including the vanilla extract into a saucepan.
Remove from the heat and leave to cool.
steps.description: Add the tablespoon of brandy once the mixture has cooled.

steps.headline: Make small balls.
steps.description: About a teaspoonful is enough to create each ball. Roll in a topping of choice, such as coconut or cocoa.

steps.headline: Keep refrigerated.
steps.description: Place into an airtight container. These will keep for up to a week.

text: Rice Krispies Place all ingredients up to and including the vanilla extract into a saucepan.  Bring to the boil. Boil for 3 minutes. Remove from the heat and leave to cool. Add the tablespoon of brandy once the mixture has cooled. Add the Rice Krispies/Rice Bubbles.  Make small balls. About a teaspoonful is enough to create each ball. Roll in a topping of choice, such as coconut or cocoa. Keep refrigerated. Place into an airtight container. These will keep for up to a week. Crushed Tea Biscuits Mix the biscuit crumbs with the cocoa, chopped walnuts, and icing sugar. Combine well. Pour in the golden syrup and the brandy.  Form small balls from the resulting mixture. Try to make them even in size. Roll the balls in the chocolate sprinkles.  Place the balls on a plate or tray covered in wax paper. Place in the fridge to chill. Keep in an airtight container until ready to serve. Consume within the week.  Sultanas Place all of the ingredients apart from the brandy into the mixing bowl. Combine well. Add the brandy to taste and mix through.  Form into evenly sized balls.  Roll in the Desiccated coconut.  Place the balls on a plate or tray covered in wax paper. Place in the fridge to chill for 30 minutes to set. Consume within the week. Keep in an airtight container until ready to serve.
